description: Dharahara, also known as Bhimsen Tower, was a nine-story tall tower located in the center of Sundhara, Kathmandu. It was built by the then Mukhtiyar (equivalent to Prime Minister) Bhimsen Thapa in 1832 BS for Queen Tripura Sundari. The tower was initially 11 stories tall, but the top two stories were damaged during the major earthquake of 1934 AD and were later rebuilt to make it a nine-story tower. The earthquake on 25th April 2015 damaged the tower completely, leaving only its base. The purpose of the construction of Dharahara was for military use as a watchtower. When incidents of national importance occurred, bugles were blown from the top floor of the tower as a signal for soldiers to assemble. This tradition continued until the collapse of the tower.

historical_events.description: Dharahara was built by Bhimsen Thapa for Queen Tripura Sundari.
The top two stories of Dharahara were damaged during the earthquake.
The tower was rebuilt to make it a nine-story tower after the earthquake.
The tower was completely destroyed, leaving only its base.

description: Dharahara, also known as Bhimsen Tower, is a historic nine-story tower located in Sundhara, Kathmandu. It was originally built by Bhimsen Thapa in 1832 BS for Queen Tripura Sundari. The tower was initially 11 stories tall, but the top two stories were damaged during the 1934 earthquake and subsequently rebuilt to stand nine stories tall. The tower was completely destroyed in the 2015 earthquake, leaving only its base intact. The tower was used for military purposes as a watchtower, and bugles were blown from the top floor to signal soldiers to assemble during national emergencies.

historical_events.description: Bhimsen Thapa built Dharahara for Queen Tripura Sundari.
The top two stories of Dharahara were damaged during the earthquake.
The tower was rebuilt to stand nine stories tall after the earthquake.
Dharahara was completely destroyed in the earthquake, leaving only its base intact.

description: Dharahara, also known as Bhimsen Tower, was a nine-story tall tower located in the center of Sundhara, Kathmandu. It was built by Bhimsen Thapa in 1832 BS for Queen Tripura Sundari. The tower was initially 11 stories tall, but the top two stories were damaged during the major earthquake of 1934 AD and later rebuilt to nine stories. The earthquake on 25th April 2015 damaged the tower completely, leaving only its base. The purpose of its construction was for military use as a watchtower. When incidents of national importance occurred, bugles were blown from the top floor of the tower as a signal for soldiers to assemble. This tradition continued until the collapse of the tower.

historical_events.event_description: Dharahara was first built by Bhimsen Thapa in 1832 BS for Queen Tripura Sundari.
The top two stories of Dharahara were damaged during the major earthquake of 1934 AD.
The tower was rebuilt to nine stories after the 1934 earthquake.
The earthquake on 25th April 2015 damaged the tower completely, leaving only its base.

description: Dharahara, also known as Bhimsen Tower, was a nine-story tall tower located in the center of Sundhara, Kathmandu. It was built by the then Mukhtiyar (equivalent to Prime Minister) Bhimsen Thapa in 1832 BS for Queen Tripura Sundari, the niece of Bhimsen Thapa. Initially, Dharahara was an 11-story tall tower, but the top two stories were damaged during the major earthquake of 1934 AD. The remaining nine stories were rebuilt later and stood as the oldest tower in the city until the 2015 earthquake, which damaged the tower completely, leaving only its base.

historical_events.description: Dharahara was first built by then Mukhtiyar Bhimsen Thapa for Queen Tripura Sundari.
The top two stories of Dharahara were damaged during the major earthquake of 1934 AD.
The remaining nine stories of Dharahara were rebuilt after the 1934 earthquake.
Dharahara was completely destroyed during the 2015 earthquake, leaving only its base.

description: Dharahara, also known as Bhimsen Tower, was a nine-story tall tower located in the center of Sundhara, Kathmandu. It was built by Mukhtiyar (equivalent to Prime Minister) Bhimsen Thapa in 1832 BS for Queen Tripura Sundari. The tower was initially 11 stories tall, but the top two stories were damaged during the major earthquake of 1934 AD and later rebuilt to be 9 stories tall. The tower was completely destroyed by the earthquake on 25th April, 2015, leaving only its base. The purpose of its construction was for military use as a watchtower. When incidents of national importance occurred, bugles were blown from the top floor of the tower as a signal for soldiers to assemble. This tradition continued until the collapse of the tower. Bhimsen Thapa built another tower eight years earlier in 1824, which was 11 stories high but was destroyed during the earthquake of 1934.

The top two stories of Dharahara were damaged during the major earthquake of 1934 AD.
The remaining 9 stories of Dharahara were rebuilt later and stood as the oldest tower in the city until the 2015 earthquake.
The earthquake in 25th April, 2015, damaged the tower completely leaving only its base.

description: Dharahara, also known as Bhimsen Tower, is a nine-storied tower located in the center of Sundhara, Kathmandu. It was originally built by Bhimsen Thapa in 1832 BS for Queen Tripura Sundari. The tower was initially 11 stories tall, but the top two stories were damaged during the major earthquake of 1934 AD and later rebuilt to stand at nine stories. The tower was completely destroyed by the earthquake on 25th April, 2015, leaving only its base intact. The tower was built for military use as a watchtower and served as a historic and cultural landmark in Kathmandu.
